content: pixie cat cave there are loads of cat cave pattern on the internet and this is a variation on the usual formula it is however the only one that produced an actual cat cave that did not fall in when completed i tried about ten times and failed until i tried this one on a whim because i had a lot of otherwise unusable acrylic yarn as you can see the construction is sturdy enough to support the roof of the cave it also holds when the cat is in but my cat decided to boycott my attempts at a photoshoot and made it look like this most of the time how to make this cat cave skill level experienced - not because of the pattern itself but because unfortunately you need to guess quite a bit as you ll see further on material some bulkier acrylic in quite a large quantity i m sorry about being so vague here but with using scrap/repurposed yarn most of time i rarely know the exact specifications this is what one strand of the yarn looked like i hope it helps you will work while holding three strands at a time as you can see in the photos i used other yarns in similar weight as well hook i used a 7 00 mm metallic hook it creates a tight sturdy fabric it also creates blisters so watch out terminology us crochet terminology the pattern r1 make a magic_ring ch3 counts as double_crochet here and throughout and is further referred to as double_crochet crochet 11dc into the ring join with a slip_stitch to the 3rd chain of initial chain r2 2dc into each double_crochet join r3 1dc increase 2dc into 1dc of previous row throughout r4 - r9 increase the number of 1dc between 2dc increases until there are seven dcs between increases alternatively just crochet on until the cat cave is big enough for your cat - my cat is small so this is the right size for her but it might not be for yours r10 1dc in each double_crochet around join r11 starting the opening work 1dcs leave 17 sts unworked turn r12 - r14 work 1dcs back and forth r15 finishing the opening 1dc in each double_crochet until you reach the gap ch17 join r16 1dc in each double_crochet 1dc in each of 17ch of previous row r17 1dc in each double_crochet around r18 1dc in each of 7dc decrease 2dc decrease in the next 2dc till end join r19 - 26 continue decreasing finish with 12 double_crochet round stitch up to close the circle you re done i don t have that much experience writing patterns so if you find a mistake please let me know i hope that if you decide to make the cave it works out well for you please do not reproduce the pattern or the pictures without permission pattern for personal use only please do not sell the finished product but if you
